definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: We keep a running tally of all profit.
sentences.chinese: 我们对所有的利润都记流水账。

sentences.english: Below the record with respect to running water Zhang that day the journey.
sentences.chinese: 下面就流水账的记录一下当日行程。

sentences.english: But despite being repetitive and long-winded, it is worth the read.
sentences.chinese: 虽然有些流水账，但依然值得阅读。

definition: variant of 流水賬|流水账[liu2 shui3 zhang4]
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
to flash back/flashback (in a novel, movie etc)
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
impression or feeling after visiting or watching (movies, museums etc)
to moan about imaginary illness/fussing like a hypochondriac/fig. sentimental nonsense
